NaClSrpcArg Struct Reference
[SRPC]

Used to convey parameters to and from RPC invocations. More...

Detailed Description

Used to convey parameters to and from RPC invocations.

It is a variant type, with the tag telling whether to treat the parameter as a bool or an array of characters, etc.

Field Documentation

int NaClSrpcArg::bval

A boolean value.

struct NaClSrpcCharArray NaClSrpcArg::caval [read]

An array of character values.

struct NaClSrpcDoubleArray NaClSrpcArg::daval [read]

An array of double-precision floating point values.

double NaClSrpcArg::dval

A double-precision floating point value.

NaClSrpcImcDescType NaClSrpcArg::hval

A handle used to pass descriptors.

struct NaClSrpcIntArray NaClSrpcArg::iaval [read]

An array of integer values.

int NaClSrpcArg::ival

An integer value.

void* NaClSrpcArg::oval

An object value that can be exported to the browser as is.

uint32_t NaClSrpcArg::reserved_pad

Padding (unused) to ensure 8-byte alignment of the union u.

char* NaClSrpcArg::sval

A zero-terminated string value.

enum NaClSrpcArgType NaClSrpcArg::tag

Determines which type this argument contains.

Its value determines which element of union u may be validly referred to.

union { ... } NaClSrpcArg::u

A union containing the value of the argument.

The element containing the valid data is determined by tag.

struct NaClSrpcVariantArray NaClSrpcArg::vaval [read]

An array of variant type values.
